steps.description: Analyze logs to identify where the null pointer exception occurs, pinpointing the exact method or line causing the issue.
Use a debugger to step through the code and check where the object is initialized, ensuring it's properly created before use.
Add null checks before using objects or use Optional to handle potential nulls gracefully, preventing exceptions.
Conduct code reviews and use static analysis tools to catch potential null pointer issues early in development.
Set up monitoring tools to gain insights into application errors and performance, aiding in real-time diagnosis.
Run unit and integration tests after implementing fixes to ensure the issue is resolved without introducing new problems.
